Yahoo! Finance Key Statistics: Download to a CSV File

Finance Key Statistics provides a wealth of financial information for publicy traded companies. It’
column6: s a free and useful statistical resource for investors to research a company&#8217

column1:
\t

The following is my solution to downloading key statistics to a CSV file.

\t

Yahoo! Finance officially supports downloading of stock data to a CSV (Comma-Separated Values) file. The download link can be found in a stock’
column2: s Summary page under the Toolbox header. Though unofficial, there is also a list of tags to select the stock data (price, P/E, etc) to be downloaded.

column1:
\t

Unfortunately this feature is not available under a stock’
column2: s Key Statistics page. Moreover, the unofficial list of tags only includes some of the key statistics data. See Yahoo! Finance: URL Download to a CSV File for details.

column1:
\t

As a result, the most feasible solution (least amount of work) for personal use was to write a script to scrape the information from a stock’
column2: s key statistics web pages. A major disadvantage, though, is the rewrites required when Yahoo! changes or rewrites their finance web pages. However, that has not happened for a while.

column1:
\t

Nonetheless, with a lack of options, a script getKeystats was written. The script is provided as is, and obtains it’
\t

\t

A Yahoo! Finance Key Statistics URL is of the form http://finance.yahoo.com/q/ks?s=[TICKER SYMBOl]+Key+Statistics, where [TICKER SYMBOL] is a variable.

\t

The script getKeystats parses the key statistics to a CSV file, a text file, and a master spreadsheet file.

\t\t
  • Data is saved into a directory Stock Data. If the directory does not exist, then it is created.
<pre><code>[TICKER SYMBOL].csv - contains the key statistics in a horizontal layout, separated by a comma
[TICKER SYMBOL].txt - contains the key statistics in a vertical layout with labels
ALL.csv - contains key statistics for all downloaded ticker symbols

\t\t
  • When the script getKeystats is run, new data is added to ALL.csv. Duplicate/outdated data is deleted.

\t\t
  • Command line usage is simple. Enter a ticker symbol, or multiple ticker symbols separated by a space.
Separate multiple tickers with a space.

column3: directory if it does not exist
